cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast (Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor area) and then forecast to slow and meander north-eastward near or just inland, bringing the center toward the upper Texas coast/Houston–Galveston region late Sunday-Monday before drifting back offshore by Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Rockport/Port Aransas

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (and Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire middle and upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and Houston ship channel
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57+ mph) likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core drifts toward Galveston Bay late Sunday–Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible from Jamaica Beach to High Island including Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 in with isolated 35 in possible through Wednesday, leading to catastrophic, prolonged flooding around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents hampering vessel movements and pilot transfers.
